help.item:
Selection box for user scope usage of this publish server.
"[shared among all users]" covers all users of the system
and is generally used for the portal publish server.
Give a name to your publish server here.
Choose the protocol to be used for the upload of data results to the server.
Enter the hostname of the server (IP or FQDN).

Enter the port on which run the server for the protocol defined
(if different of of the default one. e.g. 21 for FTP).

Enter the path of the destination directory on the server.
This may include the key '$(UID)' that will be substituted by the task ID.
Enter the username for accessing the server.
Enter the password for accessing the server.
Enter the DN of the public key in case ou use a SSL based authentication protocol.

Enter the download URL that maps this publish server.
For example: upload via ftp://myftp.server.com/$(UID)/ is mapped to
http://www.server.com/ftp-root/$(UID)/.
This publish server will be check by default on server page.
This publish server will be used by portal to store persistent metadata of task results.
